extendedIngredients.name: avocado
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons avocado, stoned, scooped and sliced

extendedIngredients.name: greek yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon sour cream or Greek yogurt

extendedIngredients.name: jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 handful cheddar and jack cheese, grated

recipes.title: Oatmeal Burrito Bowl

winePairing.pairingText: Mexican works really well with Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. You could try Trombetta Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 59 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Trombetta Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: Rich garnet color. Aromas of vanilla, clove and cooking spiceswith hints of ripe berry, pomegranate and toast. Soft entry,balanced tannin and berry fruit mingled with pleasant acidityand lingering finish.

recipes.instructions: Bring the steel cuts oats and water to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered until tender, about 30 minutes.Place the oatmeal in a bowl or on a plate and top with the cheese.Broil or microwave to melt the cheese. (Note: If you are going to broil it make sure that your dish is oven safe.)Top with the seasoned black beans, pico de gallo, avocado, and sour cream.

steps.step: Bring the steel cuts oats and water to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered until tender, about 30 minutes.

Place the oatmeal in a bowl or on a plate and top with the cheese.Broil or microwave to melt the cheese. (Note: If you are going to broil it make sure that your dish is oven safe.)Top with the seasoned black beans, pico de gallo, avocado, and sour cream.
